title: How to Make Smoked Salmon Mousse Canapés

steps.headline: Place the salmon, heavy cream, and white pepper into the blender.
steps.description: Blend the ingredients into a fine puree.

steps.headline:

steps.description: Add the cream cheese to the blender and continue blending.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/9e\/Salmon_3_693.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/9e\/Salmon_3_693.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.4666666666667,"licensing":"

steps.description: Use a spoon to transfer the puree from the blender to a piping bag and set the bag aside for now. If a piping bag isn't available, a sandwich baggie can work.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/19\/Salmon_4_932.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/19\/Salmon_4_932.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":339,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":559.8666666666667,"licensing":"

steps.description: Use a vegetable peeler to remove the skin off of the cucumbers horizontally (the long way). Create a strip pattern by leaving about a centimeter between each skin part.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/c6\/Salmon_5_663.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/c6\/Salmon_5_663.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":339,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":559.8666666666667,"licensing":"

steps.description: Cut good sized chunks out of the cucumbers.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/a4\/Salmon_6_599.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/a4\/Salmon_6_599.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":337,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":557.3333333333334,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Scoop out the middle section of the cucumber chunks with a melon ball maker. Toss away the flesh or the part you scooped out.

steps.headline: Use the piping bag to squirt some of the salmon puree into the cucumber holes.
steps.description: If a sandwich baggie is used, cut a hole in the corner of the bag.

steps.headline: Add a dab of caviar to each cucumber.
Place a sprig of dill on each set of caviar for the final touch.

text:
Place the salmon, heavy cream, and white pepper into the blender. Create a strip pattern by leaving about a centimeter between each skin part. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/c/c6/Salmon_5_663.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/c/c6/Salmon_5_663.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":339,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":559.8666666666667,"licensing":"

"} Cut good sized chunks out of the cucumbers. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/a4/Salmon_6_599.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/a4/Salmon_6_599.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":337,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":557.3333333333334,"licensing":"

"} Scoop out the middle section of the cucumber chunks with a melon ball maker. Toss away the flesh or the part you scooped out. Use the piping bag to squirt some of the salmon puree into the cucumber holes. If a sandwich baggie is used, cut a hole in the corner of the bag. Add a dab of caviar to each cucumber. Place a sprig of dill on each set of caviar for the final touch.
